intro: Waltheria excelsa var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy waltheria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
